author: stevenwonder19
title: Affordable Real Estate Investments
description: Many young or low income people cannot afford to own a house or invest in real estate to improve their lives and financial conditions.

f6_assessments.q0: We note that the proposal in question aims to use Cardano's technology to develop a new way of investing in the real estate market. We have that the proposal fits the scope of the challenge, but some reservations must be made. Given the way the problem was stated and the structuring of the site so far, we realized that the idea was conveyed very directly. Considering its complexity, perhaps the best strategy would not be to initially target the development of the platform and then sell parcels of properties on the site. The idea, structured in this way, seems to speed up the implementation of a rather new concept too much and thus raises a great doubt regarding the future success of the project. Also, given the pretension of the idea, the amount being asked of $25,000 might not be enough either. Let's take a closer look at these points later.
f6_assessments.q1:
The central idea of ​​the project aims to obtain a 'part' of a real property. The acquisition of this part would take place through a purchase with tokens, but it was not possible to find in a simple way on the website what the value of these tokens would be, and this would be a key point in the proposal. In addition, it is not possible to find the resume of any professional involved in the project. The description of the professionals needed in the project is also very general, the need for 3 developers is indicated, but what is the specialization of these developers? How much will they earn per hour worked?

The strategies indicated for marketing are also lacking in detail, there was only talk of using Twitter and Instagram to promote the idea, but without further explanation about how many people it aims to reach in the first months of disclosure, for example. As for the budget details, development and marketing expenses were mentioned, but given the complexity of the business, it seems that other aspects should also be considered. In general terms, we can see that it will not be easy to convince people to invest in real (or virtual) properties if a more elaborate plan does not exist, a recommendation would be to make more efforts to better understand a possible public adhesion to this new concept. , and reduce the amount of the budget a little, aiming to carry out, initially, a market research, instead of already trying to create the product and sell properties.
f6_assessments.q2:
For the same reasons described above, it seems that the metrics defined here to monitor the evolution of the project are not very viable, since the completeness of the site, or even the number of visits made, do not indicate whether the project will be really successful and if there is a real engagement around it.

Once again, it is a suggestion to try to channel the initial efforts to better carry out a survey with the public and establish quantitative indicators that demonstrate the public's adherence to this new way of investing in real estate.

f6_assessments.q0: Your proposal is approaching a need in today's low-income people's life that is to own cheap real estate, I think this idea is good but there will be a lot of discussions here. Firstly, how do you legalize the conversion from a real estate registration certificate to an NFT? A legal document from the competent authority in your country evidencing this would be reasonable. Second, I would like to know more details about the pros and cons of owning real property and real estate through NFT. Third, how can users rate your reliability?
f6_assessments.q1: It would be more feasible if you could provide more details on the development roadmap of this project, the roadmap is too general so voters don't really understand what you will do. As for the budget, it would be great if you could specify how much each specific work item will cost, I have tried to open all the attached documents but still can't find the details. In addition, voters also want to know specific information about who each member of your team is, what is their education level, what is their work experience (link to linked profile for proof), especially the team. Does your group have members working in the legal profession?
f6_assessments.q2: The KPI data you have given is not really specific, I suggest that you quantify it into specific metrics to measure the success of the project. There needs to be more validation, legitimacy in the local government.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal suggested a solution for people with low income to invest in real estate. But unfortunately, the challenge is seeking solutions for businesses, this solution seems inappropriate. However, there is something that this proposal could improve for making the next proposal. It is good to see that this proposal mentioned the problem first then suggested a solution. Having said that, it should describe more about the solution by adding more technical information to explain how this solution works, its activities, its features, and functions. The impact of this solution was quite well-written, emphasizing on benefits that it will bring to the target audience. Another thing that this proposal could improve for the next time is to analyze the impact of the solution on the whole Cardano Ecosystem. In fact, It lacked mentioning the role of Cardano blockchain tech supporting this solution and how it will help increase the adoption of Cardano. It could explain if more people used their product, then what would happen to Cardano like more people would know and join Cardano or it would help increase the usage of ADA currency. Besides, mentioning the challenge when executing this project, it should give a plan to overcome it.
f6_assessments.q1: The plan provided was not detailed and specific. Instead, it should break down the timeline into smaller milestones and mention what, how the project will conduct, and what is expected to achieve in each period of time. Similarly to the plan, the budget should list small activities instead of giving a general cost used for. Besides, it should mention how long the cost would be used for, how to calculate that, whether it is calculated by hours, weeks, or months. Although, it mentioned at first that the team has relevant experience in banking and managing projects, developing different technical solutions.Some people have testing & quality assurance skills. When it comes to describing the team operating this project to prove its feasibility, giving the number of members needed is not enough. Instead, it should give the information related to their profile, skills, and related experience to show how feasible this project is with the involvement of that team.
f6_assessments.q2: It seems difficult to measure the progress and the development of the project based on what was provided. It should provide the criteria to evaluate every stage of the project. For example, it said it could be measured based on the completion level of the website and app. But how to evaluate was not mentioned. It should state in each period time, the website should be set up in this part, this function or the app should be implemented in this part,....Every phase of the project should have a specific indicator to track, trace, and audit. Similar to the description of the success, it should build up specific criteria, or KPIs with specific numbers. Besides, it should confirm whether this project has been funded before or not.

f6_assessments.q0: Of the over 60 countries that enter into IMF’s Global House Index Price Index, three-quarters saw increase in house prices during 2020 – 2021, and this trend tend to continued in countries with more recent data. The increases in house prices relative to incomes make housing unaffordable to many segments of the population. Proposer want to release certain amount of tokens as proof of real estate ownership. And because house prices have a wide price range, it is better to define the price of the house you want to own. In addition, I predict that the proposer creates an investment pool for each house purchased. I think it will be better to create an investment pool for the entire portfolio of houses that will be purchased later. Since you want to provide housing to people who need a place to live, Proposer may grant discount on lease to the token owner. If they don't claim these rights, Proposer can give incentives in other forms. i.e. better rate of returns. Through this scheme, you will have 2 market segments: people who need a place to live and those who want to invest in property.
f6_assessments.q1: The concept offered by the Proposer is very similar to crowdfunding. It enables fundraisers to collect money from a large number of people via online platforms. It is an innovative way of sourcing funding for new projects, businesses or ideas. Financial pledges can be made and collected through the crowdfunding platform. And as relatively new offerings, many crowdfunding lack a lengthy track record of success. We can create a case study of buying a property through crowdfunding to map out the whole process. After that, the proposer can tell the experience starting from fundraising, buying a house, how to monetize the house to make profits that will be received by investors.
f6_assessments.q2: The team already mentions the milestone that we can use to track its progress. However, there is no detailed plan on how to use the requested budget. We can break down the budget, for example marketing through 4 times community gathering @$250, 10 times paid endorsement @$250, 12 content at IG @$50, etc. Besides that, the team can came up with detailed more measurable goals, like acquire 100 investors and or buying 3 houses. We need good indicator (KPI in number) to understand if the project is achieving what it intends. I also suggest to create a legal entity that will be the sole owner of all assets to be purchased. There could be periodic report to all investors.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem statement was clearly defined, bringing a direct correlation with one of the points addressed in the challenge.

The main connection point to the challenge is in the development of a feasibility study to use blockchain for companies that want to remove intermediaries from the value chain. Therefore, the proposal interest is aligned with the challenge scope.

Regarding the potential of the scalar solution in future challenges, this is a question that requires a deeper analysis. First of all, as it is a feasibility study, the result will tell under what conditions the business solution can be implemented and the feasibility of developing a platform to conduct this process. Secondly, from the point of view of the structure of the study, what could be used are the lessons learned from the methodology, analyzes and other issues involved.
f6_assessments.q1:
The authors of the proposal, as well as the team, have solid experience and multidisciplinary training, with decades of experience in research projects, process integration and innovation programs. In addition to the description of the experiences, I would like to see some evidence of the work of the professionals involved, since they were not included in the proposal.

The plan that was presented includes a flowchart in Miro, clarifying the steps that will be carried out and the time allocated to each one. The indication of project delivery milestones and deadline detailing for each main activity help to validate the feasibility of the proposal.

Regarding the budget, the information was divided by work specialty and by project stage. Considering the project deliverable, this is reasonable information for analysis.

As for the project risks, 2 risks were identified regarding the technical team and the consolidation of information for the production of the report.

In addition to these risks, it would be interesting to see possible risks related to the collection of information, selection of research participants, among other issues related to the execution of the study. Due to my experience leading research projects using different methodologies, such as quantitative research, focus groups and usability tests, I strongly believe that this stage, of collecting and manipulating information, is fundamental for the quality of the study.
f6_assessments.q2:
The author clarifies how he will measure the project's progress, using a Gantt chart attached to the proposal, a common tool for managing projects of this type.

The vision of the project's success is clear and strongly aligned with the solutions sought by the scope of the challenge.

One thing the author might consider adding to the proposal is establishing KPIs that will define the success of the project and how we can measure its success after final delivery.

Another point that the author may consider including in the proposal is how the community will be able to access information on the project's progress, this was not well clarified.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer behind this idea hopes to use tokens to alleviate the problem of low-income people investing in real estate. Many people can invest in a single estate and reap the same benefits. They intend to create a tokenized procedure for purchasing real estate, but in order to do so, they must first attract a large number of real estate inventory in order to form a community. There is no solution to this risk, nor is there a marketing approach to attract people. In addition, I believe a powerful third party should be present to assure the security and protocol of incorporating a token into the purchase of real estate rather than money. As input, I urge that the proposer submit a solution to improve the application and its prospects of receiving funding.
f6_assessments.q1: It would be beneficial to specify the timing following receiving the funds in the roadmap. And, in my opinion, the roadmap should be more detailed. For example, the proposal simply said that they will construct the apps and test them in the first 5 months, as well as obtain the inventory. However, the idea should be more precise about what they do during those five months. They can include the phase of developing the app, as well as the equipment used to produce the app and the testing process. Alternatively, the proposer can indicate what type of personnel and how many will be required to construct the app. I am also not sure about the budget breakdown when the proposer only gives the total amount. The proposer can divide the proposal into little parts. such as estimating the hourly work, and then proceed hour by hour. If necessary, decide the budget on heads. Finally, the proposer should include further information on each team member. If there is not a specific requirement at the present, the proposer can include some information such as skills and expertise that the proposer believes will be required for this project.
f6_assessments.q2: The key performance indicators (KPIs) for auditing the plan's development and success should be clearly defined. Of course, the community will recognize the project's accomplishment once the website is completed. Furthermore, the purpose of this proposal should contain the success probability or rate of users utilizing the app, as well as how the project would benefit the Cardano community, or even the number of connections anticipated by the proposer. I also suggest that the proposer mention a long-term goal for this project.

f6_assessments.q0:
The objective of the proposal is to build RealVerse - a shared ownership marketplace that instead of working with fiat, it would be transacted through a tokenised system. People would buy certain amounts of tokens, that would offer them partial share in a house or real estate, depending on the quota they can afford from a certain property.
While the idea behind the proposal is good, and can lead to a larger number of people owning properties, it is already a functional system, widely spread across the globe, and from the information provided, I do not see what extra benefits it would offer, and I don’t see how it is connected to the Cardano ecosystem since there is no mention about it throughout the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
The plan and timeline are very short, and would benefit from additional facts regarding the steps needed to be implemented for the proposal to be executed successfully. For example “marketing and launch campaign to spread the words” is not enough information to visualise the entire process. How will that marketing campaign be run? Social media - which platforms, what kind of advertisement will be used (text, photos, videos, animations, interviews), TV ads (what channels, what is the targeted demographic), newspaper articles/blogs etc.
The budget is not sufficiently broken-down, there are only two categories specified “Development: $10000” and ”Marketing: $15000”, but there are no further details on what exactly development means in terms of hours needed, price per hour and what kind of development would be needed.
The team members are not described at all, there is only a short enumeration of skills and team members needed, but no additional information regarding them or any third-party links to prove their skills.
f6_assessments.q2:
The progress of the project is not correctly presented, “how complete the website and app are” is a question, not an answer to the progress metrics, and “how many audiences or visitors visit the site” would work better for the success definition if it would have a specific number attached to the statement. 
The success of the progress is loosely described, “The website is up and running and we have visitors who visit our site and start investing”, and there are no milestones with identifiable measures of success.

f6_assessments.q0:
Improving people's access to real estate by fractioning assets into more accessible parts (tokenization) is a reality.  It is a process that is in its early stages of development, yet it is an idea that has already begun to drill into the minds of the market.  No player has yet fully developed the idea, although marketing and PR campaigns try to say otherwise.  Like almost everything surrounding the www3, we are in the midst of massive testing exercises, testing the limits we can reach along with the very consistency of those limits, stealing inches of space from the current physical reality until it feels cornered and forced into dialogue.  

Therefore, I think that the proposal, in its intention to improve consumer access to a capital-intensive market, has its merits to be in this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
It is common knowledge that real estate is a ... slow business. Although positive drift is very likely, i.e. over time the price will increase, an investment in real estate takes years to pay off. This slowness is mainly due to one thing: liquidity.Real estate is one of the least liquid markets on the planet. That is, there is no army of retailers or professionals entering the market to buy or sell a property (as in stocks or other assets), only a handful enter the game. And with this lack of players comes wide markets, i.e. markets in which the buying and selling prices are so far apart each other that in the end neither buyers nor sellers get fair prices: in most cases, the seller will get a price far below and the buyer will get a price far above. Creating liquidity is not an easy task, so the liquidity creation problem permeates the entire proposal.  

Therefore, a comprehensive and detailed description of the roadmap and budget is required.  It is possible that the important parts are already assembled in the website attached to the proposal. However, as I already mentioned, the problem is not the website (the form), it is the volume of activity and how the service that the proposal wants to create will generate it (the substance).  

Maybe, the proposal is in process of beginning to conceive of the possibilities available to him. It's beginning to see the world with which it can interact.
f6_assessments.q2: According to the analysis I have provided, the indicators cited are not an adequate performance measurement tool for the proposal.  The completion of the website and the number of visits is not important, it is the volume of business generated by the service created by the proponents.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a proposal about developing RealVerse which allows young and low income people to improve their financial condition by buying certain amount of tokens to own part of the house or real estate. Although this is an attractive idea to tackle the challenge, as the proposer mentioned, this project will face the risk such as how to get the initial real estate for the tokenized process and marketing RealVerse to community. It would be good if the proposer could suggest some solutions so that the community can assess that risk.
f6_assessments.q1: The budget for the proposal is listed: the fund will be used for two main section (development and marketing) but haven't broken down budget into detail and clear tasks. On the other hand, the proposer only stated the number of members but not give any information of each member such as profile, skills, or related experience, so there is no information to assess the ability to complete the project.
f6_assessments.q2: Roadmap and KPIs are provided. Regarding KPIs, I see: how complete the website and app are measuring the optimization of the website, how many audiences or visitors visit the site (through Google Analytics) is more about traffic. Beside traffic, I think we should also pay attention to the number of people participate in investing and trading on the website. We also need to know whether they visit the website just to find out some information or the participants of RealVerse. In addition, I suggest the proposer should have specific metrics for each KPIs to compared the actual operation and the proposal.
